webmorph 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    webmorph

    The goal of webmorph is to integrate with webmorph.org.

    Installation

    You can install the development version from GitHub with:

    # install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("facelab/webmorph")

    Example

    Load in all the tems from a directory. The code below loads images built into {webmorph} from the CC-BY licensed Young Adult Composite Faces.

    library(webmorph)
## basic example code

path <- system.file("extdata/composite", package = "webmorph")

tems <- read_tem(path)

    You can plot an image with the plot() function.

    plot(tems$f_multi, image = TRUE)

    plot(tems,
     color = "blue",
     image = TRUE,
     nrow = 2)

    You can also visualise just the templates. If you omit the image and don’t manually set a width and height, the x- and y-axis limit will be set automatically.

    plot(tems, 
    color = "#FF0000",
    pt.size = 2,
    pt.shape = 1,
    bg.fill = "black",
    image = FALSE,
    nrow = 2)

    You can average and visualise templates, as well.

    system.file("extdata/london", package = "webmorph") %>%
  read_tem(images = FALSE) %>%
  average() %>%
  plot(pt.colour = "orchid", bg.fill = "grey30",
       width =1350, height = 1350)
